intro: Leucosedum album, commonly known as white stonecrop, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to full sun conditions. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a ground cover. Leucosedum album is also valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
